c170e26a-9656-4663-9cb3-82287f868c75	Alexandrium andersonii	urn:lsid:marinespecies.org:taxname:246835	1996-08-01	August-September 1996	40.8408333333333	14.25	Gulf of Naples, Tyrrhenian Sea, Italy	ND			HumanObservation	present	1 - good	Montresor, M., Zingone, A. & Sarno, D. 1998. Dinoflagellate cyst production at a coastal Mediterranean site. J. Plankton Res. 20:2291-312;Penna, A., Fraga, S., Masó, M., Giacobbe, M. G., Bravo, I., Garcés, E., Vila, M., Bertozzini, E., Andreoni, F., Lugliè, A. & Vernesi, C. 2008. Phylogenetic relationships among the Mediterranean Alexandrium (Dinophyceae) species based on sequences of 5.8S gene and Internal Transcript Spacers of the rRNA operon. Eur. J. Phycol. 43:163-78.			The presence of A. andersonii cysts was recorded with sediment traps ( cyst flux <50000 cystsm-2 d-1). A culture (SZN 12) was obtained from the germination of one cyst. Ciminiello et al. (2000) is the first report of toxicity for A. andersonii. In Penna et al. (2008) appeared the molecular data for the strain SZN011 and SZN012 isolated in August 1996 with GeneBank acc. numbers AJ312440 and AJ30823.

4797519f-1230-48fc-a50f-93304b813083	Alexandrium minutum	urn:lsid:marinespecies.org:taxname:109711	2015-05-06	May 2015	37.065	15.28	Dock Cantiere Nautico, Syracuse Bay, Ionian Sea, Sicily, Italy				HumanObservation	present	1 - good	Dell’Aversano, C., Tartaglione, L., Polito, G., Dean, K., Giacobbe, M., Casabianca, S., Capellacci, S., Penna, A. & Turner, A. D. 2019. First detection of tetrodotoxin and high levels of paralytic shellfish poisoning toxins in shellfish from Sicily (Italy) by three different analytical methods. Chemosphere 215:881-92.			The concentration reported here were the maximum estimated in this area. Alexandrium species were identified by LM, Calcofluor staining and qPCR assays. Molecular qPCR assay was applied too to estimate the sxtA1 gene copy number according to Penna et al. (2015). Toxin analysis were performed by pre-COX HPLC-FLD, UHPLC-HILIC-MS/MS, and HPLC-HILIC-HRMS/MS in two different labs respectively. NOTE that here only UHPLC-HILIC-MS/MS results are given with a total PSP toxins of 1508 µg STX eq/kg. First report of tetradotoxins (TTXs) analysed by UHPLC-HILIC-MS/MS method in sellfish in Sicily.

Chemosphere 215:881-92.;Penna, A., Perini, F., Dell’Aversano, C., Capellacci, S., Tartaglione, L., Giacobbe, M. G., Casabianca, S., Fraga, S., Ciminiello, P. & Scardi, M. 2015. b3c7f74b-dc4e-46a5-9d77-c7e87681984f	Alexandrium minutum	urn:lsid:marinespecies.org:taxname:109711	2008-10-01	Autumn 2008	45.3	13.53	North Istrian Peninsula, Adriatic Sea, Croatia				HumanObservation	present	1 - good	Ujević, I., Roje-Busatto, R., Ninćević-Gladan, Z. & Marasović, I. 2012. First report of Paralytic Shellfish Poisoning (PSP) in mussels (Mytilus galloprovincialis) from eastern Adriatic Sea (Croatia). Food Control 25:285-91.			First report of PSP toxin in Croatia. Because of the presence in the Croatian waters of A. minutum (PSP producer) they suggest this species as most probable causative of this PSP event. Toxin analysis by HPLC-FLD method. Toxin concentrations reported here correspond to the maximum levels found in mussels during this period. However, these have to be considered with caution as these were old samples and during MBA test mice survived approximately 22 h. All toxins concentrations were below regulatory levels

Because of the presence in the Croatian waters of A. minutum (PSP producer) they suggest this species as most probable causative of this PSP event. Toxin analysis by HPLC-FLD method. Toxin concentrations reported here correspond to the maximum levels found in mussels during this period. However, these have to be considered with caution as these were old samples and during MBA test mice survived approximately 22 h. All toxins concentrations were below regulatory levels	
a7cb7f20-1618-4f4d-b9fa-f36dd8e9a608	Alexandrium minutum	urn:lsid:marinespecies.org:taxname:109711	2009-01-01	January - April 2009	44.76	13.92	South Istrian Peninsula, Croatia				HumanObservation	present	1 - good	Ujević, I., Roje-Busatto, R., Ninčević-Gladan, Z. & Marasović, I. 2012. First report of Paralytic Shellfish Poisoning (PSP) in mussels (Mytilus galloprovincialis) from eastern Adriatic Sea (Croatia). Food Control 25:285-91.			First report of PSP toxin in Croatia. Because of the presence in the Croatian waters of A. minutum (PSP producer) they suggest this species as most probable causative of this PSP event. Toxin analysis by HPLC-FLD method. Toxin concentrations reported here correspond to the maximum levels found in mussels during this period. Total PSP toxins (microgramSTX per eq. kilogram-1) above the regulatory levels were observed in mussels collected on 23rd February and on 9th and 26th March.

1f93491f-1855-4de7-ab0c-44950e98a675	Alexandrium pacificum	urn:lsid:marinespecies.org:taxname:833012	2015-05-06	May 2015	37.065	15.28	Dock Cantiere Nautico, Syracuse Bay, Ionian Sea, Sicily, Italy				HumanObservation	present	1 - good	Dell’Aversano, C., Tartaglione, L., Polito, G., Dean, K., Giacobbe, M., Casabianca, S., Capellacci, S., Penna, A. & Turner, A. D. 2019. First detection of tetrodotoxin and high levels of paralytic shellfish poisoning toxins in shellfish from Sicily (Italy) by three different analytical methods. Chemosphere 215:881-92.			The concentration reported here were the maximum estimated in this area. Alexandrium species were identified by LM, Calcofluor staining and qPCR assays. Molecular qPCR assay was applied too to estimate the sxtA1 gene copy number according to Penna et al. (2015). Toxin analysis were performed by pre-COX HPLC-FLD, UHPLC-HILIC-MS/MS, and HPLC-HILIC-HRMS/MS in two different labs respectively. NOTE that here only UHPLC-HILIC-MS/MS results are given with a total PSP toxins of 1508 µg STX eq/kg. First report of tetradotoxins (TTXs) analysed by UHPLC-HILIC-MS/MS method in sellfish in Sicily.

Phycol. 35:331-38. doi: 10.1046/j.1529-8817.1999.3520331.x			The bloom was caused by temporary and resting cysts found in the surface of the water. This is the first report of this species in Italian waters. No PSP toxins were found.

23dba18d-0519-4394-ba79-f6536f718e3e	Dinophysis	urn:lsid:marinespecies.org:taxname:109462	1990-02-28	January - February 1990	44.41	12.34	Emilia Romagna Coast, Adriatic Sea, Italy				HumanObservation	present	1 - good	Boni, L., Milandri, A., Poletti, R. & Pompei, M. 1993. 54073f23-ca72-451e-b44c-86e065b3e0d3	Dinophysis acuta	urn:lsid:marinespecies.org:taxname:109604	2005-04-01	April - May 2005	45.28	13.57	Western coast of the Istrian Peninsula (Station IP2), Adriatic Sea, Croatia		8		HumanObservation	present	3 - uncertain	Ninčević Gladan, Z., Skejic, S., Buzancic, M., Marasović, I., Arapov, J., Ujevic, I., Bojanic, N., Grbec, B., Kuspilic, G. & Vidjak, O. 2008. Seasonal variability in Dinophysis spp. abundances and diarrhetic shellfish poisoning outbreaks along the eastern Adriatic coast. Bot. Marina 51:449-63.			Concentrations reported here corresponded with the maximum (April) of the period that not coincided with the DSP event. Two DSP events were detected in 2005, the first in August and the second from October to November. Toxin analysis performed by mouse bioassay when they were DSP-postive, YTX and OA concentrations were determined by LC-MS/MS.	
66e53e73-8448-4c60-8e5e-c6dcac2c82ec	Dinophysis acuta	urn:lsid:marinespecies.org:taxname:109604	2005-01-01	January - September 2005	44.19	15.58	Novigrad Bay, Adriatic Sea, Croatia		14		HumanObservation	present	3 - uncertain	Ninčević Gladan, Z., Skejic, S., Buzancic, M., Marasović, I., Arapov, J., Ujevic, I., Bojanic, N., Grbec, B., Kuspilic, G. & Vidjak, O. 2008. Seasonal variability in Dinophysis spp. abundances and diarrhetic shellfish poisoning outbreaks along the eastern Adriatic coast. Bot. Marina 51:449-63.			The concentration reported here corresponds to the annual maximum reached in April and September, this species was absent in February, March, June and July. A DSP event lasted form April to August in 2005. Toxin analysis performed by mouse bioassay when they were DSP-postive, YTX and OA concentrations were determined by LC-MS/MS in case of this area vlaues reported here referred to 14th April. They suggested that the YTX concentration is due to L. polyedrum.

6f3c3679-c231-482c-9948-00880cc941dd	Dinophysis caudata	urn:lsid:marinespecies.org:taxname:109612	2005-04-01	April - November 2005	45.28	13.57	Western coast of the Istrian Peninsula (Station IP2), Adriatic Sea, Croatia		8		HumanObservation	present	1 - good	Ninčević Gladan, Z., Skejic, S., Buzancic, M., Marasović, I., Arapov, J., Ujevic, I., Bojanic, N., Grbec, B., Kuspilic, G. & Vidjak, O. 2008. Seasonal variability in Dinophysis spp. abundances and diarrhetic shellfish poisoning outbreaks along the eastern Adriatic coast. Bot. Marina 51:449-63.			Concentrations reported here corresponded with the maximum of the period (September) that coincided in between of the DSP events. Two DSP events were detected in 2005, the first in August and the second from October to November. Toxin analysis performed by mouse bioassay when they were DSP-postive, YTX and OA concentrations were determined by LC-MS/MS. They suggested that the YTX concentration is due to L. polyedrum.

A DSP event in November were observed within this year. Toxin analysis performed by mouse bioassay when they were DSP-postive, YTX and OA concentrations were determined by LC-MS/MS. They suggested that the YTX concentration is due to L. polyedrum.

9dd5a649-4661-4cbc-92ca-126f72de78d5	Dinophysis caudata	urn:lsid:marinespecies.org:taxname:109612	2005-04-01	April - November 2005	43.73	15.87	Šibenik Bay, Central Adriatic Sea, Croatia		8		HumanObservation	present	1 - good	Ninčević Gladan, Z., Skejic, S., Buzancic, M., Marasović, I., Arapov, J., Ujevic, I., Bojanic, N., Grbec, B., Kuspilic, G. & Vidjak, O. 2008. Seasonal variability in Dinophysis spp. abundances and diarrhetic shellfish poisoning outbreaks along the eastern Adriatic coast. Bot. Marina 51:449-63.			The concentration reported here corresponds to the annual maximum reached in September, this species was no recorded in May and October. Two DSP events were detected in 2005, the first in April and the second September. Toxin analysis performed by mouse bioassay when they were DSP-postive, YTX and OA concentrations were determined by LC-MS/MS.

13904ac6-2ab6-40ed-a53c-36a922ec52d0	Dinophysis fortii	urn:lsid:marinespecies.org:taxname:109624	2005-08-01	August - November 2005	45.28	13.57	Western coast of the Istrian Peninsula (Station IP2), Adriatic Sea, Croatia		8		HumanObservation	present	1 - good	Ninčević Gladan, Z., Skejic, S., Buzancic, M., Marasović, I., Arapov, J., Ujevic, I., Bojanic, N., Grbec, B., Kuspilic, G. & Vidjak, O. 2008. Seasonal variability in Dinophysis spp. abundances and diarrhetic shellfish poisoning outbreaks along the eastern Adriatic coast. Bot. Marina 51:449-63.			Concentrations reported here corresponded with the maximum (August) of the period. Two DSP events were detected in 2005, the first in August and the second from October to November. Toxin analysis performed by mouse bioassay when they were DSP-postive, YTX and OA concentrations were determined by LC-MS/MS. They suggested that the YTX concentration is due to L. polyedrum.	
fc5cb72c-16b9-42d3-b4ce-99c69ae1a60b	Dinophysis fortii	urn:lsid:marinespecies.org:taxname:109624	2005-07-01	July - October 2005	45.135	13.71	Lim Bay, Adriatic Sea, Croatia		14		HumanObservation	present	1 - good	Ninčević Gladan, Z., Skejic, S., Buzancic, M., Marasović, I., Arapov, J., Ujevic, I., Bojanic, N., Grbec, B., Kuspilic, G. & Vidjak, O. 2008. Seasonal variability in Dinophysis spp. abundances and diarrhetic shellfish poisoning outbreaks along the eastern Adriatic coast. Bot. Marina 51:449-63.			The concentration reported here corresponds to the annual maximum reached in September. A DSP event in November were observed within this year. Toxin analysis performed by mouse bioassay when they were DSP-postive, YTX and OA concentrations were determined by LC-MS/MS. They suggested that the YTX concentration is due to L. polyedrum.

81754b27-e099-4337-8fa2-532cec75043a	Dinophysis fortii	urn:lsid:marinespecies.org:taxname:109624	2006-09-29	Late Summer - Autumn	45.135	13.71	Lim Bay, Adriatic Sea, Croatia				HumanObservation	present	1 - good	Ninčević Gladan, Z., Ujević, I., Milandri, A., Marasović, I., Ceredi, A., Pigozzi, S., Arapov, J. & Skejic, S. 2011. 2f62df10-fd3c-484c-9767-6367173725f1	Dinophysis fortii	urn:lsid:marinespecies.org:taxname:109624			43.39	3.7	Gulf of Lion, Mediterranean Sea, France				HumanObservation	present	1 - good	Pavillard, J. 1923. A propos de la systématique des Péridiniens. B. Soc. Bot. Fr, 70:876-82.			Pavillard described this species from the Gulf of Lion, from samples collecte from 1903 onwards, but he didn't give the precise location in this article. However, the same author in 1909 said that his investigations were done based on samples collected in Thau Lagoon and/or near of Sete's harbour. We decided to use the coordinates of the Sete's harbour only for illustrative purposes.

Dinophysis fortii is the most abundand species among the D. spp. So it is probably the causative organism of DSP shellfish halted.

3805f254-8d3d-4256-a184-9d88d19ee391	Dinophysis sacculus	urn:lsid:marinespecies.org:taxname:232261	2005-06-01	June - November 2005	45.28	13.57	Western coast of the Istrian Peninsula (Station IP2), Adriatic Sea, Croatia		8		HumanObservation	present	1 - good	Ninčević Gladan, Z., Skejic, S., Buzancic, M., Marasović, I., Arapov, J., Ujevic, I., Bojanic, N., Grbec, B., Kuspilic, G. & Vidjak, O. 2008. Seasonal variability in Dinophysis spp. abundances and diarrhetic shellfish poisoning outbreaks along the eastern Adriatic coast. Bot. Marina 51:449-63.			Concentrations reported here corresponded with the maximum (June) of the period that not coincided with the DSP event. Two DSP events were detected in 2005, the first in August and the second from October to November. Toxin analysis performed by mouse bioassay when they were DSP-postive, YTX and OA concentrations were determined by LC-MS/MS.	
cca10375-a9ea-45b6-8ec4-d422a0256bf8	Dinophysis sacculus	urn:lsid:marinespecies.org:taxname:232261	2005-05-01	May - September 2005	45.135	13.71	Lim Bay, Adriatic Sea, Croatia		14		HumanObservation	present	1 - good	Ninčević Gladan, Z., Skejic, S., Buzancic, M., Marasović, I., Arapov, J., Ujevic, I., Bojanic, N., Grbec, B., Kuspilic, G. & Vidjak, O. 2008. Seasonal variability in Dinophysis spp. abundances and diarrhetic shellfish poisoning outbreaks along the eastern Adriatic coast. Bot. Marina 51:449-63.			The concentration reported here corresponds to the annual maximum reached in July. A DSP event in November were observed within this year. Toxin analysis performed by mouse bioassay when they were DSP-postive, YTX and OA concentrations were determined by LC-MS/MS. They suggested that the YTX concentration is due to L. polyedrum.

8cb4febf-f9d6-4255-9980-ee19784cffd2	Gonyaulax spinifera	urn:lsid:marinespecies.org:taxname:110041	2004-08-25	August 2004 - February 2005	43.97	12.74	Cattolica, Emilia Romagna Coast, North Adriatic, Italy				HumanObservation	present	1 - good	Riccardi, M., Guerrini, F., Roncarati, F., Milandri, A., Cangini, M., Pigozzi, S., Riccardi, E., Ceredi, A., Ciminiello, P., Dell'Aversano, C., Fattorusso, E., Forino, M., Tartaglione, L. & Pistocchi, R. 2009. Gonyaulax spinifera from the Adriatic sea: Toxin production and phylogenetic analysis. Harmful Algae 8:279-90.			The species was identified by LM and molecular analyses (SSU and LSU, Genebank acc. number DQ867107). Cell concentrations were estimated from samples collected on 11 October 2004 (max). The toxin value reported here is the maximum estimated from mussel samples collected on 18 November 2004 by LC-MS. Other potentially toxic species observed during this period were L. polyedrum and P. reticulatum but in lower concetrations.

Shelf Sci. 28:35-41. doi.org/10.1016/0272-7714(89)90039-5			The bloom of this species can be accompanied by a corresponding increase in bacterial population (due to organic matter biodegradation) then there was encystment then subsequent excystment producing a new red tide as the conditions returned normal. The oxigen depletion in the sea is connected with the creation of H2S (by bacterial reduction of sulphates)

The oxigen depletion in the sea is connected with the creation of H2S (by bacterial reduction of sulphates)

7d4df715-4cc8-4d89-8466-afd9d4b62ccd	Lingulodinium polyedrum	urn:lsid:marinespecies.org:taxname:233592	2005-04-01	April - October 2005	45.28	13.57	Western coast of the Istrian Peninsula (Station IP2), Adriatic Sea, Croatia		8		HumanObservation	present	1 - good	Ninčević Gladan, Z., Skejic, S., Buzancic, M., Marasović, I., Arapov, J., Ujevic, I., Bojanic, N., Grbec, B., Kuspilic, G. & Vidjak, O. 2008. Concentrations reported here corresponded with the maximum (October) of the period, during the last DSP event. Two DSP events were detected in 2005, the first in August and the second from October to November. Toxin analysis performed by mouse bioassay when they were DSP-postive, YTX and OA concentrations were determined by LC-MS/MS. They suggested that the YTX concentration is due to L. polyedrum.

0b4bdc96-0831-450d-a6fc-2af93dd56b95	Ostreopsis ovata	urn:lsid:marinespecies.org:taxname:109524	2009-07-29	July - October 2009	43.61	13.53	Passetto, Le Marche Region, North Adriatic Sea, Italy				HumanObservation	present	1 - good	Accoroni, S., Romagnoli, T., Colombo, F., Pennesi, C., Di Camillo, C. G., Marini, M., Battocchi, C., Ciminiello, P., Dell’Aversano, C. & Iacovo, E. D. 2011. Ostreopsis cf. ovata bloom in the northern Adriatic Sea during summer 2009: ecology, molecular characterization and toxin profile. Mar. Pollut. Bull. 62:2512-19.			Toxin analysis performed by HR- LC–MS, molecular analysis performed as in Penna et al. (2007) and Battocchi et al. (2010). Concentrations reported here corresponded with the seasonal maximum reached on 9 Sept. for cells and on 21st Oct. for toxins. During the bloom symptoms of human suffering were reported, including respiratory distress, rhinitis, fever, conjunctivitis and dermatitis (Martinelli et al., 2009). Moreover deaths of both benthic invertebrates (limpets, sea urchins and mussels) and several macroalgae commonly found in the area were observed.

d602a9c3-4c90-4b2f-b9b3-8ad665fc159c	Ostreopsis cf. ovata	urn:lsid:marinespecies.org:taxname:109524	2010-09-22	Mid September - October	45.1	13.62	Rovinj Coast, Croatia	1	4		HumanObservation	present	1 - good	Pfannkuchen, M., Godrijan, J., Marić Pfannkuchen, D., Iveša, L., Kružić, P., Ciminiello, P., Dell’Aversano, C., Dello Iacovo, E., Fattorusso, E., Forino, M., Tartaglione, L. & Godrijan, M. 2012. Toxin-producing Ostreopsis cf. ovata are likely to bloom undetected along coastal areas. Environ. Sci. Technol. 46:5574-82.			Cell concentration reported here correspond to the maximum reached on 3rd October in a public beach close to Rovinj. Toxin analysis performed with a HPLC-MS. Toxin concentrations correspond with the same date in which the maximum cell conc. were observed. Maximum toxin concentration were observed on 19th November with a total of 75 picogram per cell. People suffered respiratory symptoms such as coughing and rhinitis after prolonged snorkeling at the sampling site and during the handling of samples from the site. Those symptoms were subsequently also observed by the authors during the initial samplings.

9b74ae1a-8d97-4970-ae03-acaf2ef4f617	Ostreopsis ovata	urn:lsid:marinespecies.org:taxname:109524	2007-09-17	September - November 2007	43.61	13.53	Passetto, Le Marche Region, North Adriatic Sea, Italy	0.1	2		HumanObservation	present	1 - good	Totti, C., Accoroni, S., Cerino, F., Cucchiari, E. & Romagnoli, T. 2010. Ostreopsis ovata bloom along the Conero Riviera (northern Adriatic Sea): relationships with environmental conditions and substrata. Harmful Algae 9:233-39.			Area characterised by rocky bottom and shallow depths. The concentration reported here referres to the seasonal maximum reached on 1st October on the Rodophyte Hypnea musciformis. During the bloom period, some episodes of suffering for humans were reported (dyspnoea, fever, conjunctivitis, and dermatitis), together with death of benthic invertebrates (echinoderms and molluscs), which has been observed in circumscribed shallow areas.

be775d3a-1fde-4e72-8d43-4c66cc2af966	Ostreopsis spp.	urn:lsid:marinespecies.org:taxname:1023403	2013-07-03	July 2013	35.65	33.03	Vassiliko Bay, Mediterranean Sea, Cyprus	0	1		HumanObservation	present	1 - good	Tartaglione, L., Mazzeo, A., Dell’Aversano, C., Forino, M., Giussani, V., Capellacci, S., Penna, A., Asnaghi, V., Faimali, M. & Chiantore, M. 2016. Chemical, molecular, and eco-toxicological investigation of Ostreopsis sp. from Cyprus Island: structural insights into four new ovatoxins by LC-HRMS/MS. Anal. Bioanal. Chem. 408:915-32.;Accoroni, S., Romagnoli, T., Penna, A., Capellacci, S., Ciminiello, P., Dell'Aversano, C., Tartaglione, L., Abboud-Abi Saab, M., Giussani, V., Asnaghi, V., Chiantore, M. & Totti, C. 2016. Ostreopsis fattorussoi sp. nov. (Dinophyceae), a new benthic toxic Ostreopsis species from the eastern Mediterranean Sea. J. Phycol. 52:1064-84.			This Bay is a heavily impacted area of the southern coastline of Cyprus. Samples were mainly collected from the macroalgae Halopteris scoparia from which 6 strains were analysed (molecularly and toxicologically). The identification of this species as O. fattorussoi appeared in Accoroni et al. (2016) in which strains obtained in this article were used. Toxin analysis were performed with a LC-HRMS, toxins: OVTX-i, OVTX-j1, OVTX-j2 and OVTX-k were new for science.

91659e28-57f8-4d6d-9f0b-26f8bbe9709a	Dinophysis rotundatum	urn:lsid:marinespecies.org:taxname:156505	2005-01-01	January - November 2005	44.19	15.58	Novigrad Bay, Adriatic Sea, Croatia				HumanObservation	present	1 - good	Ninčević Gladan, Z., Skejic, S., Buzancic, M., Marasović, I., Arapov, J., Ujevic, I., Bojanic, N., Grbec, B., Kuspilic, G. & Vidjak, O. 2008. Seasonal variability in Dinophysis spp. abundances and diarrhetic shellfish poisoning outbreaks along the eastern Adriatic coast. Bot. Marina 51:449-63.			The concentration reported here corresponds to the annual maximum reached in April, this species was absent in March, August and September. A DSP event lasted form April to August in 2005. Toxin analysis performed by mouse bioassay when they were DSP-postive, YTX and OA concentrations were determined by LC-MS/MS. They suggested that the YTX concentration is due to L. polyedrum.	
5b9a3fab-600a-4066-a6c1-cc85fec0e6c9	Dinophysis rotundatum	urn:lsid:marinespecies.org:taxname:156505	2005-01-01	January 2005	43.73	15.87	Šibenik Bay, Central Adriatic Sea, Croatia		8		HumanObservation	present	1 - good	Ninčević Gladan, Z., Skejic, S., Buzancic, M., Marasović, I., Arapov, J., Ujevic, I., Bojanic, N., Grbec, B., Kuspilic, G. & Vidjak, O. 2008. Seasonal variability in Dinophysis spp. abundances and diarrhetic shellfish poisoning outbreaks along the eastern Adriatic coast. Bot. Marina 51:449-63.			This species was observed with less concentrations in March, June and September. Two DSP events were detected in 2005, the first in April and the second September. Toxin analysis performed by mouse bioassay when they were DSP-postive, YTX and OA concentrations were determined by LC-MS/MS.	
6dd9c2a2-ab35-45b3-8ff5-904defaca587	Dinophysis rotundatum	urn:lsid:marinespecies.org:taxname:156505	2006-09-01	Late Summer - Autumn	45.48	13.57	Savudrija basin, Croatia				HumanObservation	present	1 - good	Ninčević Gladan, Z., Ujević, I., Milandri, A., Marasović, I., Ceredi, A., Pigozzi, S., Arapov, J. & Skejic, S. 2011. Lipophilic toxin profile in Mytilus galloprovincialis during episodes of diarrhetic shellfish poisoning (DSP) in the N.E. Adriatic Sea in 2006. Molecules 16:888-99.			P. rotundatum concentrations were observed on September and the maximum levels of OA on 9th October (reported here). Toxin profiles in mussels were calculated with the LC-MS/MS technique. OA below the regulatory levels, YTX and PTX not quantificable in most of the cases.

7270b5dc-9258-44f0-81fb-97c70e978d4e	Pseudo-nitzschia	urn:lsid:marinespecies.org:taxname:149151	2015-11-04	November 2015 - January 2016	43.51	16.27	Kaštela Bay, North Adriatic Sea, Croatia	0	5		HumanObservation	present	1 - good	Arapov, J., Skejic, S., Buzancic, M., Bakrač, A., Vidjak, O., Bojanić, N., Ujević, I. & Ninčević Gladan, Ž. 2017. Taxonomical diversity of Pseudo-nitzschia from the Central Adriatic Sea. Phycol. Res. 65:1-11.			First report of DA toxins in Kaštela Bay. Species identification were performed by LM and SEM. Toxin analysis were performed by a HPLC-UV-DAD system. Concentrations and toxins (found in Venus verrucosa) reported here corresponded to the maximum total Ps. found in the period and that corresponded to 9 November at 0m. P. calliantha, P. delicatissima, P. fraudulenta, P. pseudodelicatissima/ P. cuspidata, P. subfraudulenta were detected by SEM during the studied period.

30e433b9-e99e-41fc-b718-77fdca732919	Pseudo-nitzschia calliantha	urn:lsid:marinespecies.org:taxname:246605	2007-08-21	August - October 2007	45.08	13.56	Istrian Peninsula coastline, Croatia				HumanObservation	present	1 - good	Marić, D., Ljubešić, Z., Godrijan, J., Viličić, D., Ujević, I. & Precali, R. 2011. Blooms of the potentially toxic diatom Pseudo-nitzschia calliantha Lundholm, Moestrup & Hasle in coastal waters of the northern Adriatic Sea (Croatia). Estuarine, Coastal and Shelf Science 92:323-31.			Samples during a Pseudo-n. bloom, the concentration reported here corresponded to the maximum reached along the Istrian coast (P. calliantha was observed in other 5 stations). Toxin analysis were performed by HPLC, positive values were observed in other 4 different stations. During this period positive analysis for the presence of DA were performed in Flexenopecten proteus and Pecten jacobeus. Maximum DA levels were detected Mytillus galloprovincialis on 19th November (1.32 µg/g), one month later than the maximum cell concentration.
